channel.title: [PI] christmas event need help asap please

item.title: [PI] christmas event need help asap please
item.dc:creator: @dgk_all_day1 dgk_all_day
item.description:
@dgk_all_day1 wrote:

Hello,

Im doing this tut for a christmas event and when i add the randomlottery part i cant…because im already using the same thing for my mystery boxes…

this is my problem
it wont let me do both like this

[code]public void givereward() {
if (getItems().playerHasItem(6199)) {
getItems().deleteItem(6199, 1);
getItems().addItem(randomlottery(), 1);
}
else
sendMessage(“You need 2 free slots.”);
}
public static int randomlottery[] = {15037, 15038, 15039, 14876, 14877, 14484, 13738, 13736, 11736, 11738, 11732, 11730, 11716, 11335, 10330, 10332, 10334, 10336, 10338, 10340, 10342, 10344, 10346, 10348, 10350, 10352, 10362, 10364, 10366, 10368, 10370, 10372, 10374, 10376, 10378, 10380, 10382, 10384, 10386, 10388, 10390, 10392, 10394, 10396, 10398, 6760, 6762, 6764, 4037, 4039, 4041, 4042, 3840, 3842, 3844, 3668, 3669, 3670, 3671, 3672, 3673, 3674, 3675, 3676, 3678, 2653, 2655, 2657, 2659, 2661, 2663, 2665, 2667, 2669, 2671, 2673, 2675, 2415, 2416, 2417, 4012, 2583, 2584, 2587, 2589, 2591, 2593, 2595, 2597, 2599, 2601, 2603, 2605, 2607, 2609, 2611, 2613, 2615, 2617, 2619, 2621, 2623, 2625, 2627, 2629};
public static int randomlottery() {
return randomlottery[(int) (Math.random() * randomlottery.length)];
}
/**
*Christmas Event
**/
public void givereward() {
if (getItems().playerHasItem(6542)) {
getItems().deleteItem(6542, 1);
getItems().addItem(randomlottery(), 1);
} else {
sendMessage(“You need 2 free slots.”);
}
}

		public static int randomlottery[] = {1050, 1050, 1050, 1050, 1050, 1050, 1050, 1050, 1050, 962};


		public static int randomlottery() {
			return randomlottery[(int) (Math.random() * randomlottery.length)];
			}
public int xMas;
public int pete;
public int blue;
public int red;
public int green;

	/**
	*End of Event
	**/[/code]

How do i make this work and have both of these going at the same time? is it possible?

Read full topic
